meanings.definition: A belch or eructation, especially a noisy one.
meanings.sent1: After drinking soda quickly, a loud burp escaped from his mouth.
meanings.sent2: She covered her mouth politely after the burp slipped out.
meanings.sent3: The burp at the dinner table surprised everyone, causing a moment of silence.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burp of laughter from the audience filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The burp echoed in the empty hallway, making him blush.

meanings.definition: To emit a belch or eructation.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't help but burp loudly after chugging a can of soda.
meanings.sent2: The baby burped contentedly after finishing her bottle.
meanings.sent3: The car engine seemed to burp before finally starting up.
meanings.sent4: The volcano threatened to burp out hot lava at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The old man would burp out wisdom like a fountain of knowledge.

meanings.sent1: The strange burp of the machine made everyone look around in confusion.
meanings.sent2: The burp of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The burp of the horn startled the pedestrians on the street.
meanings.sent4: The burp of the engine indicated a problem that needed fixing.
meanings.sent5: The burp of the guitar string added a unique touch to the music.
